title.native: マッシュル-MASHLE- 神覚者候補選抜試験編
title.romaji: MASHLE: Kami Shinkakusha Kouho Senbatsu Shiken-hen

description:
The second season of MASHLE, adapting the Divine Visionary Candidate Exam Arc.

After Mash Burnedead's clash with Magia Lupus, the secret about his powers is now out in the open. The short-lived celebration ends when the Bureau of Magic summons Mash before an audience of Divine Visionaries, who collectively decree Mash should reap the consequences and die. However, an evil shadow organization called Innocent Zero hijacks the inquiry to demand that Mash be kept alive.

Mash proves that he is capable of dealing with Innocent Zero, but the Divine Visionaries' verdict remains unchanged. Luckily, Mash finds unexpected allies in Divine Visionary Rayne Ames and Headmaster Wahlberg Baigan, and they successfully defer his execution until Innocent Zero is defeated. Mash is now allowed to live under one condition: he must be selected as the Divine Visionary candidate by the year's end.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: MASHLE: MAGIC AND MUSCLES - The Divine Visionary Candidate Exam Arc
肌肉魔法使-MASHLE- 神覺者候補選拔試驗篇
MASHLE: Магия и мускулы. Экзамен на звание Вестника Бога

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Fitness
tags.description: Centers around exercise with the aim of improving physical health.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

node.description:
Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.
A Japanese animator formerly affiliated with [GAINAX](https://anilist.co/studio/6).

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Website](http://creepynuts.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/creepy_nuts_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/creepynuts_official/)

A hip-hop unit consisting of [R-Shitei](https://anilist.co/staff/207162/) and [DJ Matsunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/215487/DJ-Matsunaga).

[Official Website](https://www.shiritsuebichu.jp) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ebichu_staff)

Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku is an idol group under the talent agency Stardust Promotion. 
They are the little sister group of [Momoiro Clover Z](https://anilist.co/staff/109973/Momoiro-Clover-Z).

__Members:__
・Rika Mayama (真山りか) - December 16, 1996
・Ayaka Yasumoto (安本彩花) - June 27, 1998
・Mirei Hoshina (星名美怜) - November 2, 1997
・Hinata Kashiwagi (柏木ひなた) - March 29, 1999
・Kaho Kobayashi (小林歌穂) - June 12, 2000
・Riko Nakayama (中山莉子) - October 28, 2000

__Former Members__
・Kanon Nanaki (七木奏音) - February 7, 1997
・Narumi Uno (宇野愛海) - March 19, 1998
・Hinaki Yano (矢野妃菜喜) - March 5, 1997
・Rio Koike (小池梨緒) - January 18, 1998
・Reina Miyazaki (宮崎れいな) - August 24, 1997
・Mizuki (瑞季) - February 27, 1997
・Natsu Anno (杏野なつ) - July 12, 1997
・Aika Hirota (廣田あいか) - January 31, 1999
・Hirono Suzuki (鈴木裕乃) - March 24, 1998
・Rina Matsuno (松野莉奈) - July 16, 1998 (passed away on February 8, 2017 - aged 18)
Japanese rapper a part of the famous hip-hop unit [Creepy Nuts](https://anilist.co/staff/250935/Creepy-Nuts) and hip-hop group [Umeda Cypher](https://anilist.co/staff/330554)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayuge1017)

A Tokyo Zoukei University graduate, he's one of the leading digital animators in the industry, with good character animation and catchy effects.

He is a "follower" of [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/). In his university days, he was in the same circle as [Ryuu Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/133512/). They still have a good relationship and work with each other a lot. 

He is also a good friend of [Takahito Sakazume](https://anilist.co/staff/131945/), the two working often as a "two man production team."

Enokido is mainly known for his work on the Fate franchise, being both the action director for [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/) and having directed the majority of the [Fate/Grand Order Commercials](https://anilist.co/anime/101184/).
